The judge added that other local authorities would no doubt read his judgment and may consider that they are in the same, or a sufficiently similar, factual position to claim the same relief.`` The decision is now, however, over seven months ago, and in my view any other authorities would now be far too late to apply for judicial review.`` I do not mean to trivialise so important an issue, but it may be said that fortune has favoured the brave. The judge also stressed that, provided Mr Michael Gove discharged his duty to consult fairly and take into account equality considerations,`` the final decision on any given school or project still rests with him''.
